intro: Ceropegia malwanensis, commonly known as the Malwan star-nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its succulent, trailing stems and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to withstand drought conditions. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, with a unique structure that attracts specific pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
